verses.kjv: And I said, Hear, I pray you, O heads of Jacob, and ye princes of the house of Israel; Is it not for you to know judgment?
verses.ct: Then I said, "Listen, you leaders of Jacob, you rulers of the house of Israel! Shouldn't you be the ones who understand justice?"

verses.kjv: Who hate the good, and love the evil; who pluck off their skin from off them, and their flesh from off their bones;
verses.ct: "You despise what is good and embrace what is evil. You tear the skin off my people and strip the flesh from their bones."

verses.kjv: Who also eat the flesh of my people, and flay their skin from off them; and they break their bones, and chop them in pieces, as for the pot, and as flesh within the caldron.
verses.ct: "You devour my people's flesh, rip the skin off them, and shatter their bones. You chop them up like meat for a pot, like chunks thrown into a cooking kettle."

verses.kjv: Then shall they cry unto the LORD, but he will not hear them: he will even hide his face from them at that time, as they have behaved themselves ill in their doings.
verses.ct: "Then they will cry out to the LORD, but he will not answer them. He will withdraw his favor from them at that time, because their actions have been so wicked."

verses.kjv: Thus saith the LORD concerning the prophets that make my people err, that bite with their teeth, and cry, Peace; and he that putteth not into their mouths, they even prepare war against him.
verses.ct: This is what the LORD says about the prophets who lead my people astray â€” when they have food to eat, they announce, "Peace!" but against anyone who doesn't feed them, they declare war:

verses.kjv: Therefore night shall be unto you, that ye shall not have a vision; and it shall be dark unto you, that ye shall not divine; and the sun shall go down over the prophets, and the day shall be dark over them.
verses.ct: "So darkness will come over you instead of visions, and gloom will replace your ability to predict the future. The sun will set on these prophets, and the daylight will turn black around them."

verses.kjv: Then shall the seers be ashamed, and the diviners confounded: yea, they shall all cover their lips; for there is no answer of God.
verses.ct: "The visionaries will be humiliated, and the fortune-tellers will be disgraced. They will all cover their mouths in shame, because there is no response from God."

verses.kjv: But truly I am full of power by the spirit of the LORD, and of judgment, and of might, to declare unto Jacob his transgression, and to Israel his sin.
verses.ct: "But as for me, I am filled with power through the spirit of the LORD, and with justice and courage, to confront Jacob with his rebellion and Israel with his sin."

verses.kjv: Hear this, I pray you, ye heads of the house of Jacob, and princes of the house of Israel, that abhor judgment, and pervert all equity.
verses.ct: "Listen to this, you leaders of the house of Jacob, you rulers of the house of Israel, who despise justice and twist everything that is right."

verses.kjv: They build up Zion with blood, and Jerusalem with iniquity.
verses.ct: "You construct Zion through bloodshed and Jerusalem through wickedness."

verses.kjv: The heads thereof judge for reward, and the priests thereof teach for hire, and the prophets thereof divine for money: yet will they lean upon the LORD, and say, Is not the LORD among us? none evil can come upon us.
verses.ct: "Her leaders hand down rulings for bribes, her priests give instruction for a price, and her prophets tell fortunes for money. Yet they claim to rely on the LORD, saying, 'Isn't the LORD right here with us? No disaster will come our way.'"

verses.kjv: Therefore shall Zion for your sake be plowed as a field, and Jerusalem shall become heaps, and the mountain of the house as the high places of the forest.
verses.ct: "Because of you, therefore, Zion will be plowed up like an open field, Jerusalem will be reduced to rubble, and the temple hill will become an overgrown mound in the forest."
